question.title: I am trying to use JDK version 1.8.0_202. I updated the .zshrc file to use it but when I run java -version it is showing 24.0.1
question.body:
My .zshrc file looks like

export JAVA_HOME=/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.8.0_202.jdk/Contents/Home
export PATH=$PATH:$JAVA_HOME/bin

~                                                                                   
~                                                                                   
~                                                                                   
~                                                                                   
~                                                                                   
~                                                                                   
~                                                                                   
~                                                                                   
~                                                                                   
~                                                                                   
~                                                                                   
~                                                                                   
~                                                                                   
~                                                                                   
~                                                                                   
~                                                                                   
~                                                                                   
~

When I run

java -version

it is showing

java version "24.0.1" 2025-04-15 Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 24.0.1+9-30) Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build
24.0.1+9-30, mixed mode, sharing)

The instructor wants us to use 1.8.0_202 for the exercise he is asking us to do. He also said he wants us to have it installed on our machine, as well as the latest version too.

question_comments.body: @JorgeCampos That still is no excuse to require a specific release of Java 8, that would be an excuse for requiring Java 8.
@MarkRotteveel these people are stuck in the past and too lazy to update their material hence forcing the people learning to use such old stuff.
I'm gonna give you a gift, uninstall all your java versions, and then use sdkman.io to install and manage whatever version and distro you want to use, thank me later.
@MarkRotteveel I have no idea.  I'm just following instructions.
@MarkRotteveel Because they don't want to update their teaching material, obviously.
1) Yea ... that's what I meant. 2) It actually makes little sense for the instructor to teach any Java 8. Perhaps it is time for them to update their course material ...
Why would your instructor request you use such an old and outdated version? The latest Java 8 is update 451/452 (depending on the vendor). It makes no sense to still use Java 8 update 202.
Or, ditch your manual installations, and instead let SDKMAN! locate, download, install, and uninstall Java JDK/JRE products on your Mac. So much easier.
PATH=$PATH:$JAVA_HOME/bin appends the Java bin directory to the PATH. So if PATH already has the Java 24 bin directory on the search path, appending another Java bin won't make any difference.
